page.title: 08FARMS ON MANHOOD PENINSULA
page.content: These local farms grow a variety of crops such as Winter Wheat,Winter Barley,Spring Wheat, Spring Barley, Oats,Peas,Maize,Oil Seed Rape,Clover and Mustard.The first crop of clover is used for hay,the second crop is used for seed, and the remaining stalks are ploughed in as they contain alot of Nitrogen.Mustard is also ploughed in to feed the soil. Alot of fields are given over to grass for hay and silage.In making silage,the grass is cut in May and June,and is stored in a silage clamp until it is needed for Winter feed. Certain additives and molasses are added to make a balanced diet.
